title: ChipInput – Playwright e2e: Ctrl+A/C/V + cross-input DnD
acceptance_criteria:
- Real Ctrl+A/C/V with browser clipboard
- Cross-instance drag and drop works
- Visual selection feedback verified
- Test in multiple browsers (Chrome/Firefox minimum)
- Complements RTL tests with real interactions

title: ChipInput – drag and drop semantics
acceptance_criteria:
- Reorder within same ChipInput
- Drag to another ChipInput transfers chips
- Drag cancellation does not corrupt state
- Visual feedback during drag

title: ChipInput – public API & behavioral contract
acceptance_criteria:
- Defines source of truth (state vs DOM)
- Defines controlled vs uncontrolled usage
- Cmd/Ctrl+A selects all chips
- Delete/Backspace removes selected chips
- Defines baseline copy/paste behavior between ChipInputs

title: ChipInput – RTL tests for selection + clipboard
acceptance_criteria:
- Copy preserves chip order
- Cut removes chips and updates state
- Paste into another ChipInput works (cross-instance)
- Invalid paste does not break component
- Tests cover keyboard navigation

title: ChipInput – data model & clipboard serialization format
acceptance_criteria:
- Define clipboard format (text/plain with marker or custom MIME type)
- Copy generates deterministic payload (order preserved)
- Paste reconstructs chips correctly between ChipInputs
- Fallback for pasting into normal input is defined
- Data model supports controlled mode (value/onChange)

title: ChipInput – selection & keyboard semantics
acceptance_criteria:
- Cmd/Ctrl+A selects all chips
- Shift+arrows/mouse define selection (minimal viable version)
- Delete/Backspace remove entire selection
- Caret never enters invalid state
- Focus management between chips and input field

title: ChipInput – accessibility guarantees
acceptance_criteria:
- Keyboard-only works (select/remove chips)
- Screen reader announcements defined (minimal viable)
- Focus management documented
- Appropriate ARIA roles (listbox/option or custom)
- Color contrast and visual indicators
